results.name: Smallest strictly positive integer k such that (k+1)*2^n-1 is prime.
formula: a(n)=A127587(n) if n is not in A000043. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 22 2007
a(n) << 19^n by Xylouris' improvement to Linnik's theorem. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 10 2013
maple: A127586 := proc(n) local k; k:=1 ; while true do if isprime( (k+1)*2^n-1) then RETURN(k) ; fi ; k := k+1 ; od ; end: for n from 0 to 100 do printf("%d, ",A127586(n)) ; od ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 22 2007
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 1; While[ ! PrimeQ[k 2^n + 2^n - 1], k++ ]; AppendTo[a, k], {n, 0, 50}]; a
